video.title: Flutter & Firebase Course - Build a Full Stack Instagram Clone
video.description:
Use Flutter and Firebase to build a responsive Instagram Clone. After this tutorial, you will be able to use Firebase in any of your projects. You will learn about Firestore, Firebase Auth, Firebase Storage, Responsive UI, and much more!

💻 Code: https://github.com/RivaanRanawat/instagram-flutter-clone

✏️ Course developed by Rivaan Ranawat. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC-1kzHtwBY8n0TY5NhYxNaw

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Intro
⌨️ (0:00:19) Demo
⌨️ (0:03:25) Prerequisites
⌨️ (0:04:31) Setup & Theming the App
⌨️ (0:09:31) Building Responsive Layout Widget
⌨️ (0:15:47) Setting Up Firebase
⌨️ (0:33:10) Login Screen UI (Mobile)
⌨️ (0:55:58) Signup Screen UI (Mobile)
⌨️ (1:02:41) Firebase Signup Auth
⌨️ (1:52:12) Firebase Login Auth
⌨️ (2:02:33) Persisting Auth State
⌨️ (2:19:49) Modelling User Data
⌨️ (2:25:47) User Data State Management
⌨️ (2:48:02) Mobile Bottom App Bar
⌨️ (2:57:49) Add Post Screen UI
⌨️ (3:10:08) Selecting Image
⌨️ (3:21:18) Storing Post Data in Firebase 
⌨️ (3:44:16) Feed Posts UI
⌨️ (4:10:08) Displaying Post Data from Firebase
⌨️ (4:22:04) Like Animation
⌨️ (4:36:21) Updating Likes
⌨️ (4:45:11) Comments Screen UI
⌨️ (4:59:37) Storing Comments in Firestore
⌨️ (5:09:47) Displaying Comments
⌨️ (5:25:58) Deleting Post
⌨️ (5:28:56) Searching Users
⌨️ (5:39:45) Showing Posts on Search Screen
⌨️ (5:46:06) Creating Reusable Profile Screen UI
⌨️ (6:05:41) Displaying Profile Data
⌨️ (6:27:16) Following Users
⌨️ (6:35:30) Signing Out
⌨️ (6:37:27) Creating Responsive UI
⌨️ (6:51:15) Conclusion

Resources:
🔗 colors.dart File: https://github.com/RivaanRanawat/instagram-flutter-clone/blob/master/lib/utils/colors.dart
🔗 Instagram Logo: https://github.com/RivaanRanawat/instagram-flutter-clone/blob/master/assets/ic_instagram.svg
🔗 Firestore Rules: https://firebase.google.com/docs/firestore/security/get-started
🔗 Firebase: https://firebase.google.com
🔗 Pubspec Assist: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=jeroen-meijer.pubspec-assist
🔗 In case of error while configuring Firebase for iOS: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64037496/none-of-your-spec-sources-contain-a-spec-satisfying-the-dependencies-firebase
🔗 Renaming the android package: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51534616/how-to-change-package-name-in-flutter

Dependencies:
🔗 https://pub.dev/packages/firebase_core
🔗 https://pub.dev/packages/cloud_firestore
🔗 https://pub.dev/packages/firebase_auth
🔗 https://pub.dev/packages/firebase_storage
🔗 https://pub.dev/packages/flutter_svg
🔗 https://pub.dev/packages/intl
🔗 https://pub.dev/packages/file_picker
🔗 https://pub.dev/packages/flutter_staggered_grid_view
🔗 https://pub.dev/packages/provider

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.text: Hey folks! Thanks for watching and I hope you enjoyed the course. Feel free to contact me with any questions and I'll be more than happy to answer them. Be sure to check out my channel for more full stack development tutorials.

Can you provide a simple example or any documentation link?

Thanks

Currently, this is what I am using

MasonryGridView.count(
                  crossAxisCount: 2,
                  itemCount: (snapshot.data! as dynamic).docs.length,
                  itemBuilder: (context, index) => Image.network(
                    (snapshot.data! as dynamic).docs[index]['postUrl'],
                  ),
                  mainAxisSpacing: 8,
                  crossAxisSpacing: 8,
                );

topLevelComment.author: ten
topLevelComment.text: What does exclamation mark after _image such as "_image!" means?

replies.author: Jonix
replies.text:
@SHUBH # Hey! I think you're mistaking "?" for  "!".
The exclamation mark means the value can't be null.

replies.author: SHUBH #
replies.text:
it means that the value of _image can be null
but we can not return null value
hence if _image's value is null then return a string 'null' and this is done by putting ! at the end of the variable

replies.author: 280_SAYAN BISWAS
replies.text: @Rivaan Ranawat solved issue

replies.author: Rivaan Ranawat
replies.text:
Try changing UserModel type to UserModel? And return _userModel (in the getter) 

Whenever getting the value, put a condition in the build section, that if the userModel == null, then return circularprogressindicator, else return the widget tree you want to display.

Let me know if it solves your problem!

Let me know if it solves your problem! Try changing UserModel type to UserModel? And return _userModel (in the getter)

topLevelComment.author: Yasincan olcay
ZHAN
topLevelComment.text:
3:17:03 if anyone had problem as me here. You *should* use:
*final* *UserProvider* *userProvider* *=* *Provider.of<UserProvider>(context);*
instead of: final User user = Provider.of<UserProvider>(context).getUser;
then *call* *it* by: *userProvider.getUser.photoUrl,*

topLevelComment.author: Sherlock Games
topLevelComment.text: I had one question if anyone can answer me. Why did we need to create a User Provider? Couldn't we always get the user from Firebase Auth? Why do we need to create a provider if Firebase Auth can give us the current user?

replies.author: Rivaan Ranawat
replies.text:
Hey, thanks for the question. 
Yes, we do need provider for user. Suppose we need to get the username of the user, let's say for profile screen, we will have to send a request to firebase to get that data which will take some time to load up and will cost one read request. Imagine doing that in every class. Will take up so many requests as and when the app grows bigger. 
If we have provider, it's just 1 time that we will send the request. 
Hope it makes sense to you.

Hi Rivaan! Thanks for the nice video!

replies.author: ahmad ali
replies.text: @Nico VD13 same issue but how can you solve it

replies.author: Nightmind.
replies.text:
[ALTERNATIVE SOLUTION]
Another solution would be to provide "dummy data" on the getter Function in user_provider.dart until the real data gets loaded.

User get user =>
      _user ??
      User(
        name: "Loading...", // You could also use an empty line here if you don't want to show anything -> ""
        email: "Loading...",
        uid: "Loading...",
        creationTime: DateTime(1900), // This will only be shown for a very short time
        profilePictureURL: "", // Either leave it empty or provide a standard image
      );

The ?? is the shortcut version for: "If the _user variable turns out to be Null, use the following instead"
Hope this helps!

replies.author: Syed Haris
replies.text: I'm also facing this error how to fix it?

replies.author: Birigu
replies.text:
If anyone is wondering, I found a solution. In user_provider.dart/UserProvider class change -  User? _user; to User? _user =
      (const User(email: "", uid: "", photoUrl: "", username: "", friends: [])); . Initializing it like this worked for me. Hope it works for you guys too.

topLevelComment.author: hugues mulumba
topLevelComment.text:
I've followed the tutorial step by step perfectly, but still, i'm getting an error in the main.dart file with the ChangeNotifierProvider saying that it doesn't conform to the bound 'ChangerNotifier?' of the type 'T'.
I've tried many thigs but nothing seem to work for me. Please help me!

replies.author: Rivaan Ranawat
replies.text: Do let us know if Rafael's solution worked for you!

replies.author: Rafael Alves
replies.text:
You checked if your class UserProvider extends ChangeNotifier
 (or use with, as the course uses)? Because the ChangeNotifierProvider needs and class that uses ChangeNotifier to notificate your class when some change occours.


ChangeNotifierProvider is from the provider package, see if you imported it correctly, like "import `package: provider/provider.dart" in the main.dart or if in the pudspeck.yaml it is as "provider: ^6.0.2" with the right space.

For the changenotifierProvider see if it is in the MyApp class. Before the build return your code should be like:
return MultiProvider(
provider: [
ChangeNotifierProvider<UserProvider>(
create: (_) => UserProvider(),
),
],
child: MaterialApp......... 

If you found the solution, post here, may it help others.

topLevelComment.author: Rohit Sinha
topLevelComment.text: Hii rivaan , I have a issue while coding it. At 2:41:43 ,I am getting an error  in "AuthMethods". Can you help me out ?

replies.author: Rajashanmugam
Rohit Sinha
replies.text: @Rivaan Ranawat I have imported it and name is correct, i think that function name has been changed

replies.author: Rivaan Ranawat
replies.text: @Rohit Sinha For Undefined class error, import auth_methods.dart file or check if the name of the class is AuthMethods only or you've misspelt it.

replies.author: Rivaan Ranawat
replies.text: ​@Rohit Sinha This error means that you have imported two files: firebase_auth.dart and user.dart which have the same public class named User in them thus Flutter doesn't know which User class you're talking about. So to import user.dart file, you can do it this way: import 'package:insta_clone/models/user.dart' as model; and now whenever you want to use user model, you need to use this line: user.User instead of User. (because now User is a class from firebase_auth and user.User is user model)

replies.author: Rohit Sinha
replies.text:
@Rivaan Ranawat The name 'User' is defined in the libraries 'package:firebase_auth/firebase_auth.dart' and 'package:insta_clone/models/user.dart'.
Try using 'as prefix' for one of the import directives, or hiding the name from all but one of the imports.

replies.author: Islam Merabtene
replies.text: This isn't that advanced. Many things are not done the right way especially for a production app. Like reading all the comments in one shot may cost you a fortune if it happens to have thousands of comments on a post (it takes 1000 users to open a 1000 comments post to make you pay for a 1M document reads). Of course no one would read the hole 1000 comments but the way this app is built will fetch all those comments into memory.

replies.author: Keval Shah
replies.text:
I was struggling with same and found a solution:
1. Inside Runner.xcodeproj folder, open project.pbxproj
2. Then to search, press CTRL+F
3. Search for PRODUCT_BUNDLE_IDENTIFIER
4. You will get your ios bundle id.

but you can not test your app on windows.

topLevelComment.text: How to run the simulator with vs code please explain that part please

replies.author: Rivaan Ranawat
replies.text: @FZMHD In VS Code, if you press Ctrl + J, it will open up the terminal where you can type the commands.

replies.author: FZMHD
replies.text: @Rivaan Ranawat Ok but I want to instal any extension for vs code or this command running from built in flutter function?

replies.author: Rivaan Ranawat
replies.text: Hey Mohamed, the iOS simulator is only accessible on Mac devices. To have the iOS Simulator running, you can run the command "open -a simulator" And then run the command "flutter run" To run your app.

The Gospel aka the Good News
Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand; 2 By which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain. 3 For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures; 4 And that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:
